breakdown.headline: Giochi popolari
breakdown.popularHeadline: Voti per i {{count}} giochi più popolari

explore.notLoggedIn: Impossibile caricare la libreria senza Steam ID. Visita il tuo [Profilo]({{link}}) per aggiungerne uno.

gameDetails.infoNotFound: Impossibile acquisire informazioni su App ID: {{entry}}. Questo può succedere se un gioco è stato rimosso dal negozio.

home.headline: Con Proton e Steam Play, molti giochi per Windows ora funzionano su Linux!

howDoIHelp.answer: Prova Linux! Se sei nuovo, non preoccuparti. Ecco una lista di guide per iniziare. E se vuoi aiutare a migliorare Valve e Proton, mandaci le tue valutazioni qui su ProtonDB!
howDoIHelp.question: Mitico! Come posso aiutare?

home.sampleGames: Qui ci sono un po' di giochi popolari che non sono ufficialmente ancora nella whitelist, ma hanno ricevuto molte valutazioni Platino su ProtonDB

theImpact.answer: Steam Play ora supporta ufficialmente un set limitato, ma in crescita, di giochi 'whitelisted' che sono considerati compatibili con Proton e funzionano su Linux. Prendendo in considerazione le segnalazioni su ProtonDB, un numero significante di giochi non-whitelisted, inclusi titoli molto popolari, funzionano bene come su Windows.
theImpact.question: Impatto

whatIsProton.answer: Proton è un nuovo strumento rilasciato da Valve Software che è stato integrato con Steam Play per far funzionare giochi per Windows su Linux in modo tanto semplice quanto lo è premere il bottone Play su Steam. Sotto il cofano, Proton include tra gli altri alcuni strumenti molto popolari come Wine e DXVK che un videogiocatore dovrebbe altrimenti installare e manutenere da solo. Questo allevia incredibilmente l'onere per gli utenti nel passare a Linux senza dover imparare tutti i sistemi sottostanti o dover perdere l'accesso ad una larga parte dei giochi della loro libreria. Proton è ancora agli inizi e quindi il supporto non è costante, ma migliora in continuazione.
whatIsProton.question: Cos'è Proton?

whatIsProtonDb.answer: The goal of ProtonDB is to gather reports from other gamers as they test games with Proton on Linux and provide aggregate scores of how well games perform. A growing pool of suggestions provides tweaks that you can try to get games working while Proton continues development. In addition to this, you may explore the Steam game catalog on this site to browse and discover a wide range of titles that were previously unavailable for use on Linux.
whatIsProtonDb.question: Cos'è ProtonDB?

whyBigDeal.answer: The Linux desktop experience has improved by leaps and bounds in the last year or two. Most of what you may be used to on Windows or MacOS is possible on Linux without having to tinker too much, and the tinkering can even be fun. Meanwhile, more and more of our daily interactions with a computer happen online, and browsers behave much the same on Linux as they do on other operating systems. Proton and Steam Play address a significant obstacle to adoption: gaming, where until recently there was limited compatibility.
whyBigDeal.question: Why is this a big deal?

libraryLoader.errorLoadingGames: Error loading games. Please ensure both Profile and Game Details are public on this account!
libraryLoader.headline: Steam Authentication
libraryLoader.intro: Logging in with Steam lets you submit reports and use the [Explore page with a Library filter]({{link}}) to limit results to games that you own.
libraryLoader.note: Ensure that within your [Steam Privacy Settings]({{link}}) both your 'My Profile' and your 'Game Details' are set to public. Recent changes to Steam have made those private by default. This will use the Steam Web API to retrieve public information about your account including your id, profile name and avatar. Steam will present an IP address of {{host}} for you to trust - this is expected.

misc.lastContentRefreshTime: L'ultimo aggiornamento dei contenuti è stato {{time}} fa

preferences.headline: Preferences
preferences.intro: ProtonDB displays the submitter's Steam nickname beside reports. Your unique Steam ID is not transmitted in the data of published report data. If you are concerned your nickname may be used to infer your Steam profile, you can choose a different nickname here and this will be used after the next content refresh.

profile.exploreLibrary: You can explore your library sorted with the following views:

libraryTags.headline: The following tags are common in your library. You can dive in with these:
libraryTags.lackReportsByHoursPlayed: Lack Reports by your hours played
libraryTags.lackReportsBySteamDbScore: Lack Reports by SteamDB user score

explanations.borked: Either won't start or is crucially unplayable
explanations.bronze: Runs, but often crashes or has issues preventing from playing comfortably
explanations.pending: Awaiting further reports before giving a rating
explanations.platinum: Runs perfectly out of the box
explanations.silver: Runs with minor issues, but generally is playable

stats.gamesWithNOrMoreReports: Games With N Or More Reports

suggestions.headline: Ready for more?
suggestions.intro: The following games have been selected based on hours you've played, popularity, and SteamDB rating. They all lack reports and some may only need one more to get a {{siteName}} rating! You can reload for other suggestions or go to [Lack Reports]({{link}}) filter of Explore page for even more.

systemInfo.headline: System Information
systemInfo.howTo: Gathering this information is quick if you have access to Steam settings on the machine where you play your games. [Go here to learn how]({{link}}). (Some users have reported that they need to press Ctrl-A to select everything before right clicking.)
systemInfo.intro: Reports have more utility and lend more creditibility by displaying the hardware and software the game was tested on. To keep this as accurate and consistent as possible, we leverage the system information reported by Steam itself.
systemInfo.parseFailure: Parsing failed. If you are certain you copied correctly please let us know on Discord
systemInfo.unsupportedWarning: Your system's display driver does not meet [Proton's current minimum requirements]({{link}})! You may experience crashes, slow performance, or graphical degradations. You may still submit reports and there is still value in your contributions, but your reports will show your graphics drivers in red and will not be counted toward aggregate ratings for games. Please update your drivers!
